revised_title: Neutron and X-ray Scattering from Aqueous Solutions: Structure of Multicomponent Liquids
tldr: The article discusses the determination of structures and conformations of molecules in solution using neutron and X-ray scattering techniques. It emphasizes the roles of neutron and X-ray diffraction combined with isotopic substitution to study the structure of multi-component liquids, particularly aqueous solutions. The authors present experimental results and explain the significance of the findings in understanding the structure of concentrated electrolyte solutions and the existence of a lattice-like structure in some systems.
